item.title: Gautam Gambhir, Rohit Sharma Ignore Each Other During Practice - Report Makes 'Split' Claim - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir, Rohit Sharma Ignore Each Other During Practice - Report Makes 'Split' Claim

Publication Date: January 2, 2025 | Source: NDTV

In a bizarre turn of events at the Sydney Cricket Ground, communication seemingly broke down between coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Rohit Sharma as they prepared for the final Test. Reports indicate a split in their relationship, exacerbated by Sharma's poor performance this season.

  • Gambhir and Sharma showed little communication during practice sessions.
  • Gambhir did not confirm Sharma's place in the playing eleven.
  • There are rumors of Sharma being “rested,” indicating a possible drop from the team.
  • Sharma appeared uncomfortable and isolated during practice and discussions.
  • Gambhir emphasized “honesty” and “performance” as key criteria for team selection.
“We will look at the pitch and decide,” - Gautam Gambhir on Rohit's inclusion.

The dynamic between coach and captain raises concerns about team morale and performance heading towards a critical match.

item.title: With Rohit Sharma dropped for SCG Test, India's predicted XI vs Australia - The Times of India
item.description:
India's Predicted XI vs Australia After Rohit Sharma's Omission for SCG Test

Date: Not specified
Source: Times of India

This article discusses the Indian cricket team's predicted playing XI for the upcoming Test match against Australia at the SCG, following the dropping of captain Rohit Sharma due to poor form.

  • Rohit Sharma has been dropped after a series of disappointing performances in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • His batting average for the year is significantly low at 24.76, including only two centuries.
  • KL Rahul is expected to open the batting alongside Yashasvi Jaiswal.
  • Shubman Gill is likely to return to the team after being dropped previously.
  • Jasprit Bumrah will captain the team in Rohit's absence.
“In India’s last five Test defeats, Rohit's performance has nosedived, with his average plummeting to a mere 11.20 across 10 innings.”

India is looking to bounce back after recent defeats, with a lineup that aims to balance experience and youthful talent against Australia.

item.title: "Selfish, Spiteful, Disruptive": R Ashwin Blasted By South Africa Great For Mid-Series Retirement - NDTV Sports
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: India’s surprising selection call in Melbourne needs valid reason, says Shastri - ICC Cricket
item.description:
Shastri Questions India's Selection Call Regarding Gill

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Ravi Shastri has raised concerns about India’s decision to exclude Shubman Gill from the playing XI despite his impressive performance in 2024.

  • In 12 Tests in 2024, Gill scored 866 runs at an average of 43.3, including three centuries.
  • His overall overseas performance has been inconsistent, with an average of 23.8 since 2021.
  • Shastri argues that a player averaging over 40 should not be sitting out.
“How can he be out of the XI is my question,” Shastri stated.

This statement highlights the ongoing discussions around team selection in Indian cricket.

item.title: How Rohit Sharma's dismal show in 2024 triggered his downfall - The Times of India
item.description:
How Rohit Sharma's dismal show in 2024 triggered his downfall

Publication Date: December 31, 2024 Source: Times of India

India's skipper Rohit Sharma faced a significant career downturn in 2024, showcasing a series of performances that led to his dropping from the final Test against Australia.

  • Rohit struggled throughout 2024, averaging just 24.76 in 14 Tests.
  • In key series, he failed to convert starts, highlighting technical vulnerabilities.
  • His performances included only 2 centuries and 2 half-centuries.
  • Critics cited declining footwork and captaincy challenges during crucial matches.
  • Rohit scored a mere 31 runs across five innings in the ongoing series against Australia.
  • Speculation rises over his future as captain following decisions affecting his leadership roles.
Rohit stated: "...as a captain, yes, that is disappointing... mentally, it’s disturbing without a doubt..."

The struggles Rohit faced this year have led selectors to consider younger options, with his future in Test cricket now uncertain.

item.title: "He Should Tell Virat Kohli...": India Great Blasts Gautam Gambhir's 'Batting' Coaching - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"He Should Tell Virat Kohli...": India Great Blasts Gautam Gambhir's 'Batting' Coaching

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Indian cricketer Virat Kohli faces difficulties in the ongoing Test series against Australia, raising questions about the effectiveness of head coach Gautam Gambhir's support.

  • Kohli has scored only 167 runs in four matches with an average of 27.83.
  • He has been struggling with deliveries outside the off-stump, leading to many dismissals.
  • A former player criticized Gambhir for not providing adequate guidance to Kohli.
  • Concerns grow regarding team morale and communication under Gambhir's coaching.
  • The Indian team faces challenges in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against a strong Australian side.
“If he knows what is wrong, he should tell him,” an unnamed former player stated about Gambhir's lack of communication with Kohli.

The article highlights the growing frustrations regarding the coaching staff's handling of star players amid a challenging Test series and raises questions about future performance and team dynamics.

item.title: Ruben Amorim's dream Manchester United XI if he lands FOUR transfers in January - The Mirror
item.description:
Ruben Amorim's dream Manchester United XI if he lands 4 January transfers

Publication Date: January 2025
Source: Mirror

As Manchester United struggles in early 2025, manager Ruben Amorim is eyeing key transfers in the January window to revive the team's fortunes.

  • United's four consecutive defeats have raised relegation concerns.
  • Amorim has had a rocky start, winning only four of the first eleven games.
  • Players let go could include Marcus Rashford.
  • Key transfer targets include Alphonso Davies, Bruno Guimaraes, and Dani Olmo, alongside goalkeeper Viktor Gyokeres.
“The days when teams don’t sell big players are gone,” said Eddie Howe.

Amorim needs to secure immediate reinforcements to avoid any further decline in the team's performance.

item.title: Rohit Sharma dropped for SCG Test vs Australia - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Dropped from the SCG Test Against Australia

Date: Sydney, January 2024

Source: Times of India

Rohit Sharma has been dropped from India's playing XI for the upcoming Test against Australia due to a string of poor performances. His exclusion follows a disappointing run in the series and a shift in batting positions that disrupted team balance.

  • Rohit Sharma missed the first Test for the birth of his second child.
  • He struggled in recent matches, scoring only 31 runs in five innings at an average of 6.20 in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Since March 2024, Rohit has made just 154 runs in 15 innings, averaging 10.26.
  • Gautam Gambhir is set to take over as captain for the final Test, hoping to restore energy and unity in the dressing room.
  • The new opening partnership will likely involve KL Rahul and Yashasvi Jaiswal.
“The writing was very much on the wall for the 37-year-old who was certain to bid goodbye to Test cricket after the Sydney fixture.”

With Rohit's future uncertain, the team looks to rebound in the final match of the series, aiming to retain the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

item.title: Rohit Sharma should fight out this phase: Irfan Pathan - The Times of India
item.description:
Irfan Pathan Backs Rohit Sharma to Overcome Current Challenges

Date: Not specified   Source: Times of India

Former Indian all-rounder Irfan Pathan expresses his support for Rohit Sharma, urging him to combat the difficulties he's facing in his performance and captaincy as India prepares for the final Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Rohit Sharma is facing criticism over his recent form and captaincy ahead of the final Test in Sydney.
  • Opinions are divided among critics and former players regarding his future; some suggest retirement, while others support his retention.
  • Irfan Pathan believes Rohit should not walk away from this challenge and has confidence in his ability to turn things around.
  • Pathan emphasizes that Rohit's experience will be crucial in the upcoming final Test.
  • Rohit's current batting average in 2024 is concerning at 24.76, with a stark decline in performance during recent matches.
  • As captain, Rohit's overseas record shows only two wins in eight matches, raising questions on his leadership capabilities.
“Rohit Sharma should fight out this phase. I don’t want him to walk away from this challenge. He has done enough for Indian cricket, and I’m sure he has the ability to turn things around.” - Irfan Pathan

The conclusion is that Rohit Sharma's performance under pressure and ability to adapt in critical situations are being closely observed, with the final Test set to be a decisive moment for his future.

item.title: Rohit Sharma set to be ‘rested’ for Sydney Test, Jasprit Bumrah likely to lead India in BGT finale - The Indian Express
item.description:
Rohit Sharma opts to ‘rest’ for Sydney Test, Jasprit Bumrah to lead India in BGT finale

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: The Indian Express

Rohit Sharma, the captain of India's Test team, has decided to rest for the fifth and final Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia, allowing Jasprit Bumrah to lead the team in his absence.

  • Rohit informed head coach Gautam Gambhir and chairman of selectors Ajit Agarkar about his decision.
  • Shubman Gill returns to the playing eleven, filling in for Rohit at number three.
  • KL Rahul will open the innings with Yashasvi Jaiswal.
  • Rohit's recent form has raised concerns, with an average of 6.2 in the last three Tests in Australia.
  • Bumrah will captain the crucial match, which India must win to level the series and retain the trophy.
“Everything is fine with Rohit. We are going to have a look at the wicket and announce the playing XI tomorrow.” - Gautam Gambhir

Rohit's resting raises questions about his future involvement in the team, especially with the upcoming World Test Championship cycle.

item.title: Manu Bhaker, Gukesh among four athletes to get Khel Ratna award - The Hindu
item.description:
Manu Bhaker, Gukesh among four athletes to get Khel Ratna award

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Double Olympic-medallist Manu Bhaker and chess world champion D Gukesh were among four winners of the Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna award announced by the Sports Ministry, which also named an unprecedented 17 para-athletes in the list of 32 Arjuna awardees.

  • The Khel Ratna award was awarded to Manu Bhaker, D Gukesh, Harmanpreet Singh, and Praveen Kumar.
  • The awards ceremony is scheduled for January 17, 2025, at Rashtrapati Bhavan.
  • Manu Bhaker won two medals in the last Olympics, becoming a significant figure in shooting.
  • D Gukesh became the youngest ever World Chess Champion and contributed to India's success at the Chess Olympiad.
  • The list of Arjuna awardees includes a record number of para-athletes due to their exceptional performance in the Paris Paralympics.
“The awardees will receive their awards from the President of India at a specially organised function at Rashtrapati Bhavan on 17th January, 2025.”

The Khel Ratna awardees receive a cash prize of Rs 25 lakh along with a citation and a medallion, highlighting their significant contributions to Indian sports.

item.title: Manu Bhaker to receive Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna after week-long confusion over nomination, Gukesh among four recipients - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Manu Bhaker awarded Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna amid nomination confusion

Date: Jan 02, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Manu Bhaker and D Gukesh are among the four recipients of the prestigious Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award, confirmed by the sports ministry following a week of confusion regarding Bhaker's nomination.

  • Manu Bhaker made history as the first athlete from independent India to win two medals in a single Olympic Games.
  • Along with Bhaker, Harmanpreet Singh and para-athlete Praveen Kumar also received the award.
  • Gukesh became the youngest-ever World Champion in chess.
  • The award ceremony will take place at Rashtrapati Bhavan on January 17, 2025.
“I believe there has been a lapse, possibly on my part, while filing for the nomination, which is being corrected. Irrespective of the award, I shall remain motivated to win more medals for my country.” - Manu Bhaker

This year's Khel Ratna award not only honors excellence in sports but also highlights the dedication of these athletes to inspire future generations.

item.title: 'Won't be shocked' if Rohit Sharma retires: Shastri sets record straight, tells IND captain to 'have a blast' in Sydney - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohit Sharma's Retirement Speculation: Shastri Urges Aggressive Play

Date: Jan 02, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The speculation surrounding Rohit Sharma's Test career has intensified due to his poor form and questions about his captaincy. Shastri advises him to play aggressively as the team prepares for a crucial match in Sydney.

  • Rohit Sharma has registered four single-digit scores in five innings during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • His captaincy is under scrutiny as India trails 1-2 in the series against Australia.
  • Shastri suggests that if Rohit does not improve, retirement could be a possibility.
  • He emphasizes the need for Rohit to play freely and aggressively to regain form.
“If I was anywhere near Rohit Sharma, I'll tell him, ‘Just go and smash it. Just go out there and have a blast,’” - Ravi Shastri

Shastri's insights point to the urgency for Rohit to reconsider his approach as the team faces critical matches ahead.

item.title: Gautam Gambhir Under Scanner: Report Says "Players Insecure". After Champions Trophy, Coach May Be... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir Under Scanner: Report Says 'Players Insecure'

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 Source: NDTV

Gautam Gambhir, the Indian cricket team coach, is under scrutiny following a series of poor performances by the team. After his appointment, India has struggled significantly, raising concerns about player communication and team stability.

  • Gambhir took over as head coach expecting to lead a transition in the team.
  • The team suffered losses against Sri Lanka and New Zealand, and is trailing in the ongoing Test series against Australia.
  • Reports indicate that players feel insecure due to constant lineup experimentation by Gambhir.
  • There are concerns about communication issues between Gambhir and the players, especially compared to previous coaches like Ravi Shastri.
  • With the upcoming Champions Trophy, Gambhir's position may be in jeopardy if performances do not improve.
"If the performance doesn't improve, even Gautam Gambhir's position wouldn't be safe," a senior BCCI official stated.

This situation raises questions about the future of the Indian cricket team under Gambhir as tension mounts ahead of critical tournaments.

item.title: Breaking: India set to rope in batter to replace Rishabh Pant for Sydney Test - Cricket.com
item.description:
India Brings in Sunil Gavaskar to Replace Rishabh Pant for Sydney Test

Date: Date of Publication
Source: Source of Article

In a surprising turn of events, the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is reportedly negotiating with cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar to take over for Rishabh Pant in the upcoming Sydney Test.

  • A former Indian batter with over 100 Test appearances, Gavaskar has been viewed as a potential solution to India’s recent batting troubles.
  • After a 184-run loss in Melbourne, India’s management is looking for a change in the squad.
  • Gavaskar’s return is seen as a nostalgic move, aiming to reinforce the team’s batting stability.
  • Sources suggest he is negotiating with the BCCI regarding his contract and role.
  • Gavaskar humorously commented on the changes in the game and expressed confidence in his playing style.
“Back in my day, we didn't need fancy shots; we needed patience.” - Sunil Gavaskar

The cricket community is abuzz with anticipation as Gavaskar prepares for his comeback, promising to bring wisdom and experience to the team.

item.title: Man Utd transfer news: Marcus Rashford takes action as Ruben Amorim decides priority signing - The Mirror
item.description:
Man Utd transfer news: Marcus Rashford sets the record straight as Ruben Amorim eyes key signing

Date: 03:00, 2 Jan 2025 | Source: Mirror Football

The transfer window has opened, and Manchester United is preparing for changes as rumors swirl around players like Marcus Rashford and potential signings by head coach Ruben Amorim.

  • United currently sits in 14th place in the Premier League following consecutive losses.
  • Rashford denies any talks with a new agency regarding his potential transfer, asserting his loyalty to his current representation.
  • Amorim is reportedly seeking a new goalkeeper amid concerns over Andre Onana's performances.
  • Casemiro may be considering a move to a club in the Saudi Pro League, with multiple clubs interested.
“Been a lot of false stories written over the past few weeks, but guys this is getting ridiculous - never met with any agency and don't have any plans to do so...” - Marcus Rashford

As Manchester United navigates the transfer market, key decisions will shape the future of the club and its players.

item.title: Virat Kohli Set For 'Leadership Role' In Tests, Report Says Rohit Sharma Unlikely To... - NDTV Sports
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Virat Kohli Set For India Test Captaincy Return, Report Says Rohit Sharma Unlikely To... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Virat Kohli Set For India Test Captaincy Return, Report Says Rohit Sharma Unlikely To Continue

Publication Date: September 25, 2024   |  Source: NDTV

India captain Rohit Sharma is likely to step away from Test cricket following the series against Australia, leading to speculation about Virat Kohli's potential return to the captaincy role.

  • Rohit Sharma faces heavy criticism for his recent performances and leadership following losses to New Zealand.
  • Reports suggest Rohit may not be part of India’s Test plans after the current Australia series.
  • Virat Kohli could be re-considered for captaincy due to a lack of confidence in younger players.
  • Kohli has a successful history as captain, including a Test series win in Australia.
  • Rohit's future as a player looks uncertain, with speculation about missing the decisive Test in Sydney.
  • Head coach Gautam Gambhir indicated that final decisions on team selection would be made closer to match day.
“Everything is fine with Rohit and I don't think it's anything traditional. We are going to have a look at the wicket and finalize (the team) tomorrow.” - Gautam Gambhir

The potential changes in leadership come at a crucial time for the Indian cricket team as they navigate critical Test matches.

item.title: Not Virat Kohli, Jasprit Bumrah: Video Sparks Rumour Of 25-Year-Old Replacing Rohit Sharma As India Captain In Sydney - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Not Virat Kohli, Jasprit Bumrah: Video Sparks Rumour Of 25-Year-Old Replacing Rohit Sharma As India Captain In Sydney

Date: January 2, 2025
Source: NDTV

The upcoming India vs Australia Test match in Sydney raises questions about Rohit Sharma's captaincy as he struggles with form. Discussion of a possible leadership change has emerged, with speculation about Shubman Gill stepping up.

  • Rohit Sharma's future as captain is uncertain as India trails 1-2 in the series.
  • Coach Gautam Gambhir did not confirm Rohit's inclusion in the playing XI.
  • Shreevats Goswami suggests Shubman Gill may captain the team in Sydney.
  • Rohit struggled with runs, averaging just 6.20 in recent matches.
  • Akash Deep ruled out due to a back injury, but no replacement named.
“I just said that we're going to have a look at the wicket and announce a playing XI tomorrow. The answer remains the same.” — Gautam Gambhir

The outcome of the Sydney Test is crucial for India's hopes of reaching the World Test Championship final, requiring a win and some favorable results from Australia.

item.title: Can Indian spinners do an Anil Kumble in spin-friendly Sydney? - SCG trivia - The Times of India
item.description:
Can Indian spinners do an Anil Kumble in spin-friendly Sydney? - SCG trivia

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

India aims to end a 46-year wait for a Test match victory in Sydney as they prepare for the final match of the Border Gavaskar Trophy at the SCG, which historically favors spin bowlers.

  • India's last win at the SCG was in January 1978.
  • They currently trail the series 2-1 after winning one match and losing two.
  • The upcoming match's result will impact the retention of the Border Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Ravichandran Ashwin's absence puts pressure on spinners Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar.
  • Statistics highlight Kumble’s prowess at the SCG with match figures of 12 for 279 runs.
  • Sachin Tendulkar boasts an impressive record, averaging 157.00 at SCG.
“Will one of them do a Kumble for India? Time will tell.”

The significance of this match lies not only in historical statistics against Australia but also in the opportunity for India’s spin attack to shine and potentially reshape the series outcome.

item.title: Ravi Shastri speculates on Rohit Sharma's retirement from Test cricket - The Times of India
item.description:
Ravi Shastri speculates on Rohit Sharma's retirement from Test cricket

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Former Indian coach Ravi Shastri speculated about Rohit Sharma’s potential retirement from Test cricket, especially in light of his age and performance challenges during the current series.

  • Shastri indicated Sharma's retirement would not be shocking given the emergence of younger players.
  • Rohit has struggled in the current series, averaging just 6.2 runs across three matches.
  • Shastri encourages Rohit to take an aggressive approach in his potential final match.
  • The fifth Test match of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy is crucial for India's hopes of qualifying for the World Test Championship final.
“If I was anywhere near Rohit Sharma, I'll tell him, ‘Just go and smash it. Just go out there and have a blast’.”

Shastri emphasizes the importance of Rohit playing his natural, aggressive game to finish his career on a high note.

item.title: Steve Smith to return as Australia Test captain - Crictoday
item.description:
Steve Smith to Return as Australia Test Captain

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Crictoday

Steve Smith is likely to lead Australia in the two-match series against Sri Lanka as regular captain Pat Cummins wishes to spend time with his family, particularly with his wife expecting their second child.

  • Pat Cummins may skip the series to be with family.
  • If Australia beats India, they will qualify for the World Test Championship final.
  • Cummins expressed the importance of family time, especially after losing his mother.
  • The two Tests against Sri Lanka will take place from January 29 to February 6.
“It is important to give preference to your responsibilities. I am trying to find joy in life, and my approach towards the game has changed.” - Pat Cummins

The decision marks a significant shift for the Australian team as they aim to qualify for the World Test Championship.

item.title: India's dressing room confidentiality breach an unexpected storm, 'leak' reeks of Chappell-Ganguly, Kohli-Kumble feuds - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India's Dressing Room Confidentiality Breach: A Storm of Controversy

Date: Jan 02, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

In an unexpected turn of events, leaks from within the Indian cricket team following a disappointing defeat against Australia have raised concerns about the sanctity of the dressing room. This breach of confidentiality has drawn parallels to past controversies involving high-profile figures in Indian cricket.

  • The dressing room is traditionally a private space for players to express themselves freely.
  • Recent alleged leaks come just before a crucial Test match, highlighting the timing's unfortunate nature.
  • Historical precedents show detrimental effects of such leaks on team dynamics and morale.
  • The head coach has publicly addressed the situation, emphasizing the need for honesty and integrity among players.
  • Drawing from past resilience, the team aims to overcome adversity and focus on performance.
“Those are just reports. That's not the truth... Honesty is extremely important if you want to go on and achieve some great things.” - Head Coach Gautam Gambhir

This situation underscores the challenges faced by the team but also serves as a reminder of their capacity to rally together and perform against the odds.

item.title: Shubman Gill among 4 Gujarat Titans players likely to be summoned by CID in ₹450 crore scam: Report - Mint
item.description:
Shubman Gill and Gujarat Titans Players Potentially Involved in ₹450 Crore Ponzi Scam

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Live Mint

India international Shubman Gill is among four cricketers from Gujarat Titans who may be summoned by the CID in connection with a ₹450 crore ponzi scam.

  • Other cricketers involved include Sai Sudharshan, Rahul Tewatia, and Mohit Sharma.
  • The kingpin of the ponzi scheme, Bhupendrasinh Zala, confessed during interrogation that he had not returned the money invested by the players.
  • Gill reportedly invested ₹1.95 crore, while the others invested smaller amounts.
  • Zala was arrested after being on the run for nearly a month and is currently in custody until January 4.
“So far, we have learnt that nearly 11,000 individuals had invested in schemes floated by Zala's firm.” - Parikshita Rathod, Deputy Inspector General of Police (CID-Crime)

The case highlights the risks of ponzi schemes and the importance of rigorous financial scrutiny in investment opportunities.

item.title: BPL 2024-2025: Match 5, DC vs DBR Match Prediction – Who will win today’s BPL match between DC vs DBR? - CricTracker
item.description:
BPL 2024-2025: Match 5 Prediction - Dhaka Capital vs Durbar Rajshahi

Date: January 2, 2025 | Source: CricTracker

The excitement of T20 cricket continues with Match 5 of the Bangladesh Premier League between Dhaka Capital (DC) and Durbar Rajshahi (DBR), both teams looking to secure their first win in this tournament.

  • DC lost their opening match by 40 runs.
  • DBR's first game was closely contested but they couldn't defend their target.
  • Match details: January 2, 2025, at Shere Bangla National Stadium, Mirpur.
  • Pitches are better for batters initially, but expected to favor spinners as the tournament progresses.
Prediction: Durbar Rajshahi is expected to win today's match.

The performance of key players like Yasir Ali and Taskin Ahmed could be decisive in determining the match outcome.

item.title: IND vs AUS 5th Test Date, Live Streaming: Playing XI prediction, head-to-head stats, pitch report and weather update - The Indian Express
item.description:
IND vs AUS 5th Test Schedule, Live Streaming, Date, Pitch Report, Weather

Date: Upcoming Friday

Source: Indian Express

India will face Australia in the fifth Test at Sydney, with Australia currently leading the series 2-1 after a thrilling victory in Melbourne. India's batting remains a concern as they head into this crucial match.

Key Details

Predicted XIs

India: KL Rahul, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Shubman Gill, Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant (wk), Ravindra Jadeja, Nitish Kumar Reddy, Dhruv Jurel, Prasidh Krishna, Jasprit Bumrah (c), Mohammed Siraj.

Australia: Sam Konstas, Usman Khawaja, Marnus Labuschagne, Steve Smith, Travis Head, Beau Webster, Alex Carey (wk), Pat Cummins (c), Nathan Lyon, Scott Boland, Mitchell Starc.

Head-to-Head Records

Matches Played: 111, India Wins: 33, Australia Wins: 47, Drawn: 30

Pitch Report

The Sydney pitch usually favors batters initially, with spinners getting assistance later. Rain may also aid bowlers this time.

Weather Report

The first four days of the match look promising, but rain is expected on the final day and the day prior.

Live Streaming

The match will be telecasted on Star Sports Network and streamed on Hotstar in India.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah breaks Waqar Younis's record to go top of this list - The Times of India
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah breaks Waqar Younis's record to go top of this list

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Jasprit Bumrah has achieved remarkable success in 2024, surpassing Waqar Younis's record to become the best red-ball bowler in international cricket. He has claimed a total of 86 wickets across formats, establishing new benchmarks for average and strike rate.

  • Bumrah achieved 86 wickets in 21 matches in 2024.
  • He averaged 13.76 with an impressive strike rate of 26.9.
  • His performance eclipsed Waqar Younis's previous records set in 1990.
  • Bumrah is currently leading wicket-taker in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
“Bumrah is the leading Test wicket-taker of 2024, with 71 wickets at 14.92 runs apiece in 13 matches.”

Bumrah’s record-breaking performance has positioned him as one of the modern greats in cricket, solidifying his status as a top bowler for the Indian team.

item.title: Gambhir non-committal on Rohit Sharma's selection for SCG Test - Cricbuzz
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Shubman Gill to return to India playing XI? India coach tightlipped over team as Rohit Sharma remains low - The Times of India
item.description:
Shubman Gill to Return to India's Playing XI? Coach Gambhir Keeps Options Open

Publication Date: Date Not Provided | Source: Times of India

Shubman Gill is in discussions to return to India's lineup for the fifth Test in Sydney after missing the previous match. Coach Gautam Gambhir remains non-committal but hints at a potential return for Gill.

  • Gill had a conversation with Gambhir as the team prepared for the match.
  • He missed the fourth Test to make room for Washington Sundar but could rejoin the XI.
  • The decision on the playing XI will be finalized after assessing pitch conditions on match day.
  • Akash Deep is confirmed out due to a back issue, the only injury concern.
Gambhir stated, "We will look at the wicket and announce the playing XI tomorrow."

The situation surrounding Gill’s potential return remains dynamic and is subject to final assessments leading up to the Test match.

item.title: Shastri’s say on Rohit Sharma retirement speculation - ICC Cricket
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.
